item.title: Slot to hold talks with Salah about facing Brighton
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he will speak with Mohamed Salah on Friday morning about whether he will be involved against Brighton on Saturday.

item.title: BBC to show Macclesfield and Spurs FA Cup ties
item.description: Non-league Macclesfield's FA Cup third round tie with holders Crystal Palace will be televised live on BBC One on Saturday, 10 January (12:15 GMT kick-off).

item.title: Rooney 'got death threats' after making Man Utd move
item.description: Former England striker Wayne Rooney says he received death threats when he made the move from boyhood club Everton to Manchester United in 2004.

item.title: 'There can only be one singer' - my secrets of successful man-management
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at man-management and how dealing with unhappy players is not the only challenge a manager will face.

item.title: 'Nancy exposed to brutal life as Celtic manager as cup final looms'
item.description: BBC Scotland's chief sportswriter, Tom English, dissects Wilfried Nancy's start as Celtic manager with the Premier Sports Cup final looming.

item.title: A win 30 years in the making - how Igor Jesus ended Forest wait
item.description: Igor Jesus took just 82 seconds to end Nottingham Forest's 30-year wait for an away win in Europe - and celebrated in increasingly familiar style.

item.title: Why Dewsbury-Hall is thriving at Everton after Chelsea exit
item.description: Midfielder Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall returns to Stamford Bridge on Saturday in outstanding form as Everton look to leapfrog Chelsea in the Premier League.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Barcelona 'not a pressure' for on-loan Rashford
item.description: Marcus Rashford says he finds nothing at Barcelona "a pressure" and is at the club to "enjoy myself" as he continues to thrive since his move from Manchester United.

item.title: Is Saka an alternative to Haaland as captain? The FPL talking point
item.description: With Premier League leaders Arsenal hosting bottom club Wolves, is it time to captain Bukayo Saka in your fantasy football team? Our FPL experts give their views.

item.title: Bronze's 'beautiful' chip features in UWCL goals of the week
item.description: Strikes from Lucy Bronze, Linda Caicedo and Melchie Dumornay all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Daly scores in 27 seconds as Villa put three past Liverpool
item.description: Rachel Daly scores her first two goals of the season, including one in the first 27 seconds of the match, as Aston Villa beat Liverpool 3-0 in the Women's Super League.

item.title: There are 'no reasons to not want Salah to stay' at Liverpool - Slot
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says there are "no reasons to not want Mohamed Salah to stay" at the club and will hold further talks with the forward on Friday.

item.title: I'm learning a new football language - Rashford
item.description: Marcus Rashford speaks to BBC Sport Spanish football reporter Elizabeth Conway about how he is settling into life with Barcelona.

item.title: Macclesfield FC 'saved his life' - how football club owner overcame addiction
item.description: Football club owner Rob Smethurst discusses how Macclesfield FC contributed to overcoming a personal struggle with addiction.

item.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

item.title: Villa defeat 'reality check' for struggling Liverpool
item.description: Under-pressure Liverpool manager Gareth Taylor says his side have had a "real reality check" as their winless start to the Women's Super League season continues.

item.title: Lampard wins second manager of the month award
item.description: Coventry City boss Frank Lampard is named the Championship's manager of the month for November with striker Ellis Simms winning the player award.

item.title: Top-of-table Scottish Championship showdown starts live on BBC
item.description: Ayr United host leaders St Johnstone on a weekend when the top four sides in the Scottish Championship go head-to-head.

item.title: 'Monumental betrayal' - cheapest World Cup final ticket to cost Â£3,119
item.description: Fans' group Football Supporters Europe says it is "astonished" by Fifa's "extortionate" pricing strategy for World Cup tickets.

item.title: Bayern Munich plan talks with Guehi - Friday gossip
item.description: Bayern Munich plan to hold talks with Marc Guehi about a potential move, Tottenham will try to sell Yves Bissouma in January, Aston Villa looking to send Harvey Elliot back to Liverpool, plus more.

item.title: Rangers 'as bad as I've seen' as Keane revels in Ferencvaros win
item.description: Rangers were comfortably second-best as they slumped to yet another Europa League defeat, according to victorious Ferencvaros boss Robbie Keane.

item.title: Wolves got summer transfers 'wrong' - club execs
item.description: Wolves got their transfer business "wrong" in the summer, says technical director Matt Jackson - while under-fire executive chairman Jeff Shi empathises with protesting fans.

item.title: Is Salah right to feel 'thrown under the bus'?
item.description: BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty takes a look at whether the Liverpool striker's claim is justified.

item.title: 'Northerners are tougher than southerners!' - Tottenham confessions
item.description: Tottenham players including Bethany England, Kit Graham, Jessica Naz and Lena Gunning-Williams share their confessions, including unpopular opinions and their team-mate icks.

item.title: Why 'phenomenon' Williams is on radar of Europe's top clubs
item.description: BBC Sport asks fans and experts in Bilbao to explain why Athletic Club winger Nico Williams is attracting the attention of Europe's biggest clubs in his debut Champions League season.

item.title: Salah's five-hour bus journey to football training aged 12
item.description: How Mohamed Salah defied the odds and never gave up on his challenging journey from rural Egypt to become a footballer.

item.title: Man Utd score four as winless Wolves booed
item.description: Watch highlights as Wolves lose 4-1 to Manchester United, suffering their eighth-straight loss in the Premier League.

item.title: Liverpool, Man City and Spurs in running for Semenyo
item.description: Antoine Semenyo's future looks set to dominate the forthcoming transfer window with rival clubs circling.

item.title: Does Nancy 'know what he's walked in to' amid horror Celtic start?
item.description: Wilfried Nancy has become the first Celtic manager to lose his first two games sparking concerns amid the club's supporters.

item.title: Which three Arsenal assets to pick v Wolves? FPL team of week
item.description: A home match for Arsenal against dismal Wolves is the key fixture for FPL managers to target this week - it's just a case of deciding which three Gunners to select.

item.title: Slot 'no clue' if Salah has played his last Liverpool game
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "I have no clue" when asked if Mohamed Salah has played his last game for Liverpool.

item.title: Villa could still go up another level - Sutton
item.description: Chris Sutton and Conor Coady discuss Aston Villa's title credentials and their admiration for manager Unai Emery on the Monday Night Club.

item.title: 'I understand their anger' - Edwards on Wolves fans' boos
item.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Rob Edwards says he can understand some of the anger fans have with the club following their 4-1 defeat at home to Manchester United.

item.title: Shade scores hat-trick as Burton beat non-league Brackley
item.description: Watch highlights as Burton Albion beat Brackley Town 3-1 to reach the FA Cup third round, thanks to a hat-trick from Tyrese Shade.

item.title: Amorim hails Mount after win at Wolves
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim praises the performance of Mason Mount after the midfielder scored in a 4-1 win at Wolves

item.title: 'Salah's put his team-mates in jeopardy' - Coady
item.description: Chris Sutton and Conor Coady break down Mohamed Salah's fallout with Liverpool on the Monday Night Club.

item.title: Guehi scores late header to secure Crystal Palace win over Fulham
item.description: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi scores a late header for a 2-1 win against Fulham which moves them into the top four in the Premier League.

item.title: Brighton equalise in stoppage time against West Ham
item.description: Georginio Rutter scores a controversial equaliser for Brighton as they draw 1-1 to deny West Ham United the chance to escape the relegation zone.

item.title: Nine-man Real Madrid implode in home defeat to Celta Vigo
item.description: Real Madrid lose 2-0 at home to Celta Vigo in La Liga, going down to nine-men in the process after both Fran Garcia and Alvaro Carreras are sent off.

item.title: Watch: Best of weekend action from around the leagues
item.description: Watch the best of the action from the SPFL weekend, as Arbroath make progress at the top of the Championship and there are two thrillers in League Two.

item.title: EFL five things to watch: Bosses in crisis and a Bristolian reunion
item.description: BBC Sport looks ahead to the weekend's most intriguing fixtures with just two rounds of games left in the EFL before Christmas.

item.title: 'Taught me everything' - Swindon boss Holloway on Bristol Rovers return
item.description: Swindon boss Ian Holloway on the emotions of returning to hometown club Bristol Rovers as an opposition manager for the first time.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: 'A stunning team performance' as Chelsea share goals around against Roma
item.description: Five players wrote their names on the scoresheet as Chelsea saw off Roma in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
item.description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

item.title: World Cup ticket ballot opens - here's all you need to know
item.description: The main ticket ballot for next summer's World Cup in North America opens on Thursday with 'record high' prices for fans.

item.title: Messi to unveil 70ft statue of himself on 'GOAT' tour
item.description: Lionel Messi is heading to India to unveil a 70ft statue of himself as part of a three-day 'GOAT Tour'.

item.title: BBC to show Scotland's first World Cup game since 1998
item.description: The BBC will broadcast Scotland's first World Cup match since 1998, when they take on Haiti on 14 June, plus their final group match against Brazil and England's group match against Ghana.

item.title: Man Utd humbled by Lyon - but key lessons learned
item.description: Manchester United were given a demonstration of what it takes to be Europe's best on Wednesday night - but Marc Skinner hopes his side can learn from it.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: 'You have to stand up and be counted' - history repeats itself for Newcastle
item.description: Newcastle United show immense spirit to come from behind against Bayer Leverkusen only to concede another late goal.

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: Are Man Utd turning the tide or is a 'bad result just around corner'?
item.description: Manchester United moved into the Premier League top six with their biggest win of the season - but they still have to prove the doubters wrong.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Everyone follows fashion' - is Premier League better now than 20 years ago?
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at what has changed in the Premier League in the past couple of decades and whether it is for the better, from a manager's perspective.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: How did Littler get Man Utd away tickets - and why has it sparked debate?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore how Luke Littler got Manchester United away tickets against Wolves on Monday evening.

item.title: Why is there a 15:30 Champions League match?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why there is a 15:30 GMT kick-off in the Champions League on Tuesday

item.title: What is an 'Olimpico' goal in football?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the definition of and origins behind the 'Olimpico' goal

item.title: 'It was handball, wasn't it?' - why Rutter goal against West Ham stood
item.description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.

item.title: Who is Arsenal's teenage debutant Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal bring 16-year-old Marli Salmon on as a substitute against Club Brugge in the Champions League, but who is he?

item.title: 'Scotland's Doig on Forest shortlist' - gossip
item.description: Scotland left-back Josh Doig is reportedly of interest to Nottingham Forest, while clubs are said to be eyeing Rangers pair Djeidi Gassama and Nicolas Raskin.

item.title: Aberdeen and council move towards stadium agreement
item.description: The two parties hold "positive" talks over new stadium plans for the Scottish Premiership side.

item.title: Fenerbahce captain's home raided in Turkish betting scandal
item.description: Players, club directors, a commentator and a referee are among the latest to be arrested in Turkey's betting scandal.

item.title: Unlucky own goal helps Gladbach beat Mainz
item.description: Watch highlights, as the Bundesliga's bottom side Mainz 05 suffer a narrow defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: Real's Courtois asks fans to stop abuse of players
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold out for two months
item.description: England defender Trent AlexanderâArnold will be out for about two months after sustaining a thigh injury during Real Madrid's win over Athletic Club.

item.title: Nice condemn fans over 'unacceptable' player confrontation
item.description: Nice condemn a group of fans in the "strongest possible terms" after cplayers and staff were physically confronted on their return home following Sunday's 3-1 defeat at Lorient.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
